hints.content:
Bert uses $\goldE{14\text { mL}}$ of shampoo.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 3 milliliters to 18 milliliters. Tick marks 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18 milliliters are labeled. 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown before 3 milliliters, 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown after 18 milliliters, and there are 2 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The shampoo inside the graduated cylinder measures to the second unlabeled tick mark above 12 milliliters. A line extends from the second unlabeled tick mark above the 12 milliliters tick mark and is labeled 14 milliliters. !

hints.content:
Bert uses $\greenD{12\text { mL}}$ of conditioner.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 3 milliliters to 18 milliliters. Tick marks 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18 milliliters are labeled. 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown before 3 milliliters, 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown after 18 milliliters, and there are 2 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The conditioner inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 12 milliliters. A line extends from the tick mark at 12 milliliters and is labeled 12 milliliters. !

hints.content:
We add the measurements together to find how many milliliters of shampoo $(\goldE{14 \text { mL}})$ and conditioner $(\greenD{12 \text { mL}})$ Bert uses.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total volume. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 14 milliliters. The shorter right part is labeled 12 milliliters. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Shampoo. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Conditioner. !

hints.content: Bert uses $\blueD{26\text { mL}}$ of shampoo and conditioner to wash his hair.

question.content:
Bert the bunny is going to use up all of the shampoo and conditioner shown below to wash his fur today.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How many milliliters of shampoo and conditioner does Bert use to wash his fur?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 3 milliliters to 18 milliliters. Tick marks 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18 milliliters are labeled. 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown before 3 milliliters, 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown after 18 milliliters, and there are 2 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The shampoo inside the graduated cylinder measures to the second unlabeled tick mark above 12 milliliters. !

A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 3 milliliters to 18 milliliters. Tick marks 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, and 18 milliliters are labeled. 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown before 3 milliliters, 2 unlabeled tick marks are shown after 18 milliliters, and there are 2 unlabeled tick marks between every 2 labeled tick marks. The conditioner inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 12 milliliters. !
